briefTitle: Montelukast Back to School Asthma Study (0476-340)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Male and female non-smoking Participants, ages 6 to 14 years, with chronic asthma, history of at least one asthma exacerbation associated with a cold within the past year and a documented history of asthma that required treatment with any asthma medication within 6 months prior to Visit 1

Exclusion Criteria:

* Participant cannot have any other acute or chronic pulmonary disorder, or hospitalization for asthma more than three times within one year prior to signing informed consent

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Percentage of Days With Worsening Asthma (as Measured on Daily Diaries) in Pediatric Asthmatic Participants
outcomeMeasures.description: A day of worsening asthma is a day with: increase from baseline in β-agonist use (\> 70% and a min increase of 2 puffs); \> 50% increase from baseline in daytime symptoms score; awake "all night"; increase from baseline in inhaled corticosteroid use ≥ 100% or oral corticosteroid rescue for worsening asthma; or unanticipated healthcare utilization.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With the Occurrence of One or More Health Care Utilizations (as Measured on Daily Diaries)
outcomeMeasures.description: Health care utilization is defined as unanticipated asthma care in an office or clinic, emergent or hospital setting.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Days With Increased β-agonist Use by >70% and a Minimum Increase of 2 Puffs From Baseline (as Measured on Daily Diaries) in Pediatric Asthmatic Participants
Percentage of Days With Increased Daytime Asthma Symptom Score by >50% From Baseline (as Measured on Daily Diaries) in Pediatric Asthmatic Participants
outcomeMeasures.description: Daytime asthma symptom score was calculated as the sum of the responses (0 (best) to 5 (worst)) to three daytime symptom questions.
